item.title: Kendra add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "The path of least resistance leads to crooked rivers and crooked men." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "As to conforming outwardly and living your own life inwardly, I do not think much of that." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "be yourself- not your idea of what you think somebody else's idea of yourself should be." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I have never found a companion that was so companionable as solitude." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "<b>In the morning I bathe my intellect in the stupendous and cosmogonal philosophy of the Bhagvat-Geeta, since whose composition years of the gods have elapsed, and in comparison with which our modern world and its literature seem puny and trivial</b>; and I doubt if that philosophy is not to be referred to a previous state of existence, so remote is its sublimity from our conceptions. I lay down the book and go to my well for water, and lo! there I meet the servant of the Bramin, priest of Brahma and Vishnu and Indra, who still sits in his temple on the Ganges reading the Vedas, or dwells at the root of a tree with his crust and water jug. I meet his servant come to draw water for his master, and our buckets as it were grate together in the same well. The pure Walden water is mingled with the sacred water of the Ganges." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I would rather sit on a pumpkin, and have it all to myself, than be crowded on a velvet cushion." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For nonconformity the world will whip you with its displeasure." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Things are always different than what they might be...If you wait for them to change, you will never do anything." -- Henry James

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Sidonie-Gabrielle Colette
item.description: "There are days when solitude is a heady wine that intoxicates you with freedom, others when it is a bitter tonic, and still others when it is a poison that makes you beat your head against the wall." -- Sidonie-Gabrielle Colette

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings
item.description: "Madness is only a variety of mental nonconformity and we are all individualists here." -- Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Andrew Wyeth
item.description: "I prefer winter and fall, when you can feel the bone structure in the landscape---the lonliness of it---the dead feeling of winter. Something waits beneath it---the whole story dosen't show." -- Andrew Wyeth

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I had not intended to love him; the reader knows I had wrought hard to extirpate from my soul the germs of love there detected; and now, at the first renewed view of him, they spontaneously revived, great and strong! He made me love him without looking at me." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "If all the world hated you and believed you wicked, while your own conscience approved of you and absolved you from guilt, you would not be without friends." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj
item.description: "It is always the false that makes you suffer, the false desires and fears, the false values and ideas, the false relationships between people. Abandon the false and you are free of pain; truth makes happy, truth liberates." -- Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "To argue with a man who has renounced the use and authority of reason, and whose philosophy consists in holding humanity in contempt, is like administering medicine to the dead, or endeavoring to convert an atheist by scripture." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "There is a determined though unseen bravery that defends itself foot by foot in the darkness against the fatal invasions of necessity and dishonesty. Noble and mysterious triumphs that no eye sees, and no fame rewards, and no flourish of triumph salutes. Life, misfortunes, isolation, abandonment, poverty, are battlefields that have their heroes; obscure heroes, sometimes greater than the illustrious heroes." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Eric Hoffer
item.description: "Rudeness is the weak man's imitation of strength." -- Eric Hoffer

item.title: Kendra add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Maggie, we're through with lies and liars in this house. Lock the door." -- Tennessee Williams
